title: What Botox is and how it works
summary: Botox is a neuromodulator that relaxes targeted muscles to soften expression lines.
body: Botox works by temporarily reducing muscle activity where it is placed, which can soften lines caused by repeated facial expressions. Results are subtle and gradual, and timing varies by person.

title: How to prepare for a Botox consultation
summary: Know your goals, bring questions, and expect a face-by-face assessment.
body: A good consult focuses on your goals, your natural expressions, and your comfort level. Ask about what outcomes are realistic, how subtle changes are planned, and how follow-ups are handled.

title: Facial balance and fillers
summary: Fillers are about restoring harmony, not changing who you are.
body: Providers often look at the face as a whole - how features relate in proportion and profile. Subtle volume changes can restore balance without making anything look done.

title: What to expect at a filler consult
summary: You'll discuss goals, symmetry, and a conservative plan.
body: A thoughtful consult includes a full-face assessment, discussion of concerns, and a plan that prioritizes subtle changes over instant transformation.

title: What actually affects metabolism
summary: Consistency, sleep, stress, and muscle mass matter more than hacks.
body: Metabolism is influenced by activity, recovery, and muscle. Sustainable routines beat quick fixes because they support hormones, energy, and adherence.

title: Mindset for sustainable change
summary: Small, repeatable wins beat all-or-nothing plans.
body: Aim for habits that are simple enough to repeat on busy days. Consistency creates momentum and reduces the pressure to be perfect.

title: Peptides in simple terms
summary: Peptides are short chains of amino acids that can signal processes in the body.
body: Think of peptides as small messengers. Different peptides are studied for different roles, which is why clear goals and good sources matter.

title: Hype vs. real in peptide science
summary: Research is promising in some areas, but not all claims are equal.
body: Some peptides have emerging evidence, others are mostly theoretical. It is smart to ask what is studied, in whom, and for how long.

title: What hormone balance means
summary: It is about symptoms, patterns, and overall wellbeing, not a single number.
body: Hormones work as a system, so balance is often about trends and how you feel over time. A licensed clinician can interpret labs in context.

title: Preparing for a hormone consult
summary: Bring symptom timelines, lifestyle factors, and questions.
body: Helpful context includes changes in sleep, energy, mood, and cycle patterns. That context helps a provider interpret labs thoughtfully.
